intro: Phanera altiscandens, commonly known as the scandent phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit, with slender stems that twine around supporting structures. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
